wikipedia_page.main: Madge Gertrude Adam (6 March 1912 – 25 August 2001) was an English solar astronomer who was the first postgraduate student in solar physics at the University of Oxford observatory.

response: She moved to St Hugh's College Oxford in 1935 to teach mathematics alongside Dorothy Wrinch to undergraduates of five women's colleges.  Influenced by Madge Adam and Harry Plaskett, she shifted her interest to applications of maths in astronomy and physics.
